page.title: 19Teenagers in Wimbish
page.content: Living in a small village does have its disadvantages, especially for teenagers. The distances involved in travelling from one village to another, or to a town, are large enough to make meeting up with friends and going to social occasions very difficult. Wimbish has only a limited bus service, so we either have to be taken everywhere by car, or we have to cycle. Even within the village itself there is little to cater for young people of the 13 to 18 age range. A youth club or some sort of regular club would benefit an isolated hamlet such as Tye Green.There used to be discos in the Village Hall, but these were stopped due to the damage being done to the premises. Equally, it is difficult getting a part time job to earn some pocket-money, as most job opportunities are outside the village.
